channel.title: Status on Srikanth Perinkulam
channel.description: Recent content in Status on Srikanth Perinkulam

item.title: 02 Nov 2025 00:00
item.description:
ssp
2025-11-02T14:49:59.058Z
@gobino Haven't hit their 10mb/month limit yet!
gobino
2025-10-30T13:42:52.000Z
Protecting your email identity with free tools (Proton, Duck, Mozilla, Addy) üì±I got more serious about online safety, transitioning from 1 email address to several, outlining why and the (free) tools you can use as well.https://gobino.be/protecting-your-email-identity-with-free-tools-proton-duck-mozilla-addy/#blog
hyde
2025-10-30T15:25:39.000Z
@gobino have you checked https://aliasvault.net ?
gobino
2025-10-30T15:32:52.000Z
@hyde crap, I forgot when diving into those tools ü§¶I should have checked and included your solution as well.
srgower
2025-10-31T00:06:36.000Z
@gobino great write-up! Lots of things I hadn't considered before and more options available than I realized.
gobino
2025-10-31T13:08:18.000Z
@srgower thanks!Yea, I also wasn‚Äôt aware or thinking about it all. Everyone needs to define for themselves what to do, but I feel I‚Äôve been too lenient with everything.And if you have any questions, shoot.
ssp
2025-10-31T23:13:28.889Z
@gobino I've been using addy.io for about three years now. Super reliable and I love their on-the-go alias generation.
gobino
2025-11-01T10:30:51.000Z
@ssp Yea, it looks to be a very gold and solid solution.Are you still using the free tier? Or did you upgrade?

item.title: 29 Oct 2025 00:00
item.description:
ssp
2025-10-29T11:41:35.878Z
@maique You've been having a rough few days!
maique
2025-10-29T09:14:58.000Z
üò† Carried the TV down to the garage, and got it into the car. All set.Garage door is malfunctioning, cars all stuck inside. How‚Äôs your day going?
OnceUponAGoblin
2025-10-29T09:22:02.000Z
@maique pelo menos tens tv para ver üòπ
maique
2025-10-29T09:24:57.000Z
@OnceUponAGoblin Mas‚Ä¶ mas‚Ä¶ a tv est√° com cenas, por isso estava no carro.Ia levar para arranjo, tinha tempo hoje üòî
AlexWolfe
2025-10-29T14:04:34.000Z
@maique Better than yours. I only had to give blood this morning.
maique
2025-10-29T15:58:49.000Z
@AlexWolfe Hahahahaha... After many hours, the technicians came, saw they lacked the parts to fix it, but left the garage door open. Cars are, again, free to roam! No needles involved!
AlexWolfe
2025-10-29T17:25:06.000Z
@maique Yippie, and why do they always arrive without the needed parts? And glad you didn‚Äôt have to be ‚Äúneedled‚Äù. üòõ
maique
2025-10-30T07:46:19.000Z
@AlexWolfe ¬Ø\_(„ÉÑ)_/¬Ø It‚Äôs part of their workflow? Hahahahaha. This time they came prepared for a broken spring, but both springs failed!
AlexWolfe
2025-10-30T13:43:40.000Z
@maique I guess it true, they can‚Äôt carry everything at all times. üôÉ
rameez
2025-10-30T08:26:06.000Z
@maique reminds me of https://youtu.be/AbSehcT19u0
maique
2025-10-30T09:47:50.000Z
@rameez Hahahahaha. Missed this one!
mihobu
2025-10-30T10:29:33.000Z
@rameez @maique I have lived this many times

item.title: 26 Oct 2025 00:00
item.description:
ssp
2025-10-26T22:17:43.193Z
@hund Not quite. I have a script that fetches all my activity data from Garmin Connect every month or so. For now I just generate raw summaries and a few maps churned out of it. Just something fun to tinker with once in a while. Pretty psyched about Gadget bridge though!
hund
2025-10-26T16:20:55.000Z
I replaced Garmin Connect with Gadgetbridge. It's open source, and it runs offline on your device.It seems to have all the essential features. I even have "smart notifications" on my watch.https://f-droid.org/packages/nodomain.freeyourgadget.gadgetbridge#Garmin #Gadgetbridge #Android #Fdroid
ClintonAnderson
2025-10-26T16:25:18.000Z
@hundAnd it be used while Connect is still installed, to test it????
hund
2025-10-26T17:12:58.000Z
@ClintonAnderson It should work if you unpair the watch first.
ClintonAnderson
2025-10-26T17:14:30.000Z
@hundCool!Worth a try for fun at least
killyourfm
2025-10-26T16:26:38.000Z
@hund üëÄInteresting. Garmin Connect is infuriating. It can't seem to display ANYTHING without your phone having an internet connection. It can't even sync without data, which seems ludicrous. You'd think it would be a straightforward bluetooth connection. (All of this means when I'm in the backcountry or very remote, I can't see activity data, sleep data, or sometimes even calories burned.)How does Gadgetbridge handle that?
hund
2025-10-26T17:14:17.000Z
@killyourfm It's all local on your phone. As long as Bluetooth work, you're good to go. :)
killyourfm
2025-10-26T19:18:58.000Z
@hund BRILLIANT!
hund
2025-10-26T19:23:02.000Z
@killyourfm :D
zlatin
2025-10-26T17:30:06.000Z
@hund Have you managed to somehow transfer your history data from Garmin Connect to Gadgetbridge?
hund
2025-10-26T17:40:24.000Z
@zlatin Nope. I haven't looked into that yet. :)
ssp
2025-10-26T19:56:33.334Z
This is fantastic, @hund ! Thanks for the nudge! I did try Gadgetbridge a few years ago. They didn't quite support Garmin then. Gave it a spin just now and looks like they've come a long way! So far I've been exporting my garmin to my site but nothing like a full fledged app with all the bells and whistles.https://srikanthperinkulam.com/2025/10/26/gadget-bridge/
hund
2025-10-26T21:39:15.000Z
@ssp I'm glad that you found value in my post!Have you created your own fitness tracker website thingy or what?I honestly don't know what to do with my data.. I only find value in resent data, so I can keep track of my current fitness and how active I've been.
oecher_olli
2025-10-31T14:36:01.000Z
@hund Muss ich doch direkt einmal ausprobieren
hund
2025-10-31T14:38:14.000Z
@oecher_olli Good luck!

So far I've been exporting my garmin to my site but nothing like a full fledged app with all the bells and whistles.https://srikanthperinkulam.com/2025/10/26/gadget-bridge/

item.title: 25 Oct 2025 10:30
item.description: TIL certain watches ‘skip seconds’ to conserve battery and to indicate that they are almost out of charge. Noticed this in my Fossil watch a few weeks ago and didn’t bother finding out why. Today, it went dead and only then did I connect the dots! Super neat! Skip a second, warn but still keep time. This is similar to a vehicle’s indicator light flashing quicker when the bulb’s blown. üîó
item.content:encoded: TIL certain watches ‘skip seconds’ to conserve battery and to indicate that they are almost out of charge. Noticed this in my Fossil watch a few weeks ago and didn’t bother finding out why. Today, it went dead and only then did I connect the dots! Super neat! Skip a second, warn but still keep time. This is similar to a vehicle’s indicator light flashing quicker when the bulb’s blown. üîó

item.title: 19 Oct 2025 10:30
item.description: Finally got around adding an about page on this site. Can’t believe it took me twenty years for this! Maybe I’ve found myself! üîó
item.content:encoded: Finally got around adding an about page on this site. Can’t believe it took me twenty years for this! Maybe I’ve found myself! üîó

item.title: 14 Oct 2025 17:30
item.description:
Two weeks into the shutdown and neither party seems to be in a rush to sort this out. Thankfully we have decent savings. Also does help that the state department has always paid two weeks late. This paycheck should be about 70% my regular paycheck accounting for work done until Sep 30th. There’s talk of this shutdown maybe making it to Thanksgiving. Historically, they’ve responded when ATC / TSA folks threw in their towels…This time around might be different though.

M wants to go to London with S. Thinking we should be able to absorb that cost. And then there’s the Virginia trip. Might be a pricey end of the year!

On the work front, looks like that Malabo trip is gonna happen.

Cameroon had its elections last sunday and Issa Tchiroma unilaterally declared victory today. Something that the Constitutional Council said would be considered ‘High treason’. They made it so far with very little unrest. Next few weeks though portends to be interesting! The worlds’ oldest and longest serving president might not be all so benevolent after all. üîó
item.content:encoded:
Two weeks into the shutdown and neither party seems to be in a rush to sort this out. Thankfully we have decent savings. Also does help that the state department has always paid two weeks late. This paycheck should be about 70% my regular paycheck accounting for work done until Sep 30th. There’s talk of this shutdown maybe making it to Thanksgiving. Historically, they’ve responded when ATC / TSA folks threw in their towels…This time around might be different though.

M wants to go to London with S. Thinking we should be able to absorb that cost. And then there’s the Virginia trip. Might be a pricey end of the year!

On the work front, looks like that Malabo trip is gonna happen.

Cameroon had its elections last sunday and Issa Tchiroma unilaterally declared victory today. Something that the Constitutional Council said would be considered ‘High treason’. They made it so far with very little unrest. Next few weeks though portends to be interesting! The worlds’ oldest and longest serving president might not be all so benevolent after all. üîó

item.title: 13 Oct 2025 10:30
item.description: On my list of ‚Äòthings to sort‚Äô is a bunch of files and physical documents that we’re compelled to move from place to place as we relocate every few years. I’ve been considering getting a document scanner to digest these files digitally and get rid of them. It’s been on my mind for a few years now and I think I’ve reached that decision threshold to bite the bullet and get a scanner. Now these devices run anywhere between 200 and 600 USD that I am NOT interested in spending for this indulgence. I’ll most likely hunt for one on ebay or backmarket sticking to my recycled hardware whenever feasible stand. The Fujitsu Fi 6130 seems to fit that ‘cheap and best’ bucket if sourced second hand. They seem to be selling for about 70 USD. üîó
item.content:encoded: On my list of ‚Äòthings to sort‚Äô is a bunch of files and physical documents that we’re compelled to move from place to place as we relocate every few years. I’ve been considering getting a document scanner to digest these files digitally and get rid of them. It’s been on my mind for a few years now and I think I’ve reached that decision threshold to bite the bullet and get a scanner. Now these devices run anywhere between 200 and 600 USD that I am NOT interested in spending for this indulgence. I’ll most likely hunt for one on ebay or backmarket sticking to my recycled hardware whenever feasible stand. The Fujitsu Fi 6130 seems to fit that ‘cheap and best’ bucket if sourced second hand. They seem to be selling for about 70 USD. üîó

item.title: 01 Oct 2025 09:30
item.description:
For a day.

Switched off my phone from airplane mode first thing this morning to check on the ‘Shutdown’ status and as expected congress did fail to secure those 60 votes. Also received a couple emails mentioning my position was non-excepted and hence I was effectively furloughed.

Received another email around 2200 stating my position is now considered excepted and I need to report back to work the next working day. Alrighty, we’re back in business. üîó
item.content:encoded:
For a day.

Switched off my phone from airplane mode first thing this morning to check on the ‘Shutdown’ status and as expected congress did fail to secure those 60 votes. Also received a couple emails mentioning my position was non-excepted and hence I was effectively furloughed.

Received another email around 2200 stating my position is now considered excepted and I need to report back to work the next working day. Alrighty, we’re back in business. üîó
